bin/cbst.c

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /**********************************************************doxygen*//** @file
00002  * @brief   Constrained bottleneck spanning tree solver.
00003  *
00004  * Solves the constrained bottleneck spanning tree (CBST) problem the given 
00005  * input file.
00006  *
00007  * @author  John LaRusic
00008  * @ingroup bin
00009  ****************************************************************************/
00010 #include "common.h"
00011 #include "lb.h"
00012 
00013 /* Global variables */
00014 char *program_name;             /**< Program name */
00015 char *input_file = NULL;        /**< Given input TSPLIB file */
00016 char *xml_file = NULL;
00017 double max_length = -1.0;
00018 
00019 /* Program options */
00020 #define NUM_OPTS 3
00021 arrow_option options[NUM_OPTS] = 
00022 {
00023     {'i', "input", "TSPLIB input file", 
00024         ARROW_OPTION_STRING, &input_file, ARROW_TRUE, ARROW_TRUE},
00025     {'x', "xml", "File to write XML output to",
00026         ARROW_OPTION_STRING, &xml_file, ARROW_FALSE, ARROW_TRUE},
00027     {'L', "length", "Maximum length of spanning tree",
00028         ARROW_OPTION_DOUBLE, &max_length, ARROW_FALSE, ARROW_TRUE}
00029 };
00030 char *desc = "Constrained bottleneck spanning tree solver";
00031 char *usage = "-i tsplib.tsp [options] ";
00032 
00033 /* Main method */
00034 int 
00035 main(int argc, char *argv[])
00036 {   
00037     int ret = ARROW_SUCCESS;
00038     
00039     arrow_problem problem;
00040     arrow_problem_info info;
00041     arrow_bound_result result;
00042     
00043     /* Read program arguments */
00044     if(!arrow_options_parse(NUM_OPTS, options, desc, usage, argc, argv, NULL))
00045         return EXIT_FAILURE;
00046     if(max_length < 0.0)
00047     {
00048         arrow_print_error("No length or negative max. length given.");
00049         return EXIT_FAILURE;
00050     }
00051 
00052     /* Try and read the problem file and its info */
00053     if(!arrow_problem_read(input_file, &problem))
00054         return EXIT_FAILURE;
00055     if(!arrow_problem_info_get(&problem, ARROW_FALSE, &info))
00056         return EXIT_FAILURE;
00057     /* Note: Algorithm does not require hash table */
00058     
00059     /* Solve CBST */
00060     if(!arrow_cbst_solve(&problem, &info, max_length, &result))
00061     {
00062         arrow_print_error("Could not solve CBST on file.");
00063         return EXIT_FAILURE;
00064     }
00065     
00066     printf("\nCBST Solution: %d\n", result.obj_value);
00067     printf("Total Time: %5.2f\n", result.total_time);
00068     
00069     /* Print out XML file if required */
00070     if(xml_file != NULL)
00071     {
00072         FILE *xml;
00073         if(!(xml = fopen(xml_file, "w")))
00074         {
00075             arrow_print_error("Could not open xml file for writing");
00076             ret = ARROW_FAILURE;
00077             goto CLEANUP;
00078         }
00079         
00080         fprintf(xml, "<arrow_bound type=\"CBST\" ");
00081         fprintf(xml, "problem_file=\"%s\"", input_file);
00082         fprintf(xml, " command_args=\"");
00083         arrow_util_print_program_args(argc, argv, xml);
00084         fprintf(xml, "\">\n");
00085         fprintf(xml, "    <objective_value>%d</objective_value>\n", 
00086                 result.obj_value);
00087         fprintf(xml, "    <total_time>%5.2f</total_time>\n", 
00088                 result.total_time);
00089         fprintf(xml, "</arrow_bound>\n");
00090         
00091         fclose(xml);
00092     }
00093         
00094 CLEANUP:
00095     arrow_problem_destruct(&problem);
00096     arrow_problem_info_destruct(&info);
00097     return ret;
00098 }
